revision.comment: Change topic to match [[WP:GA]] page, replaced: =history → =War using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text: {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=14:48, 3 April 2010 |action1link=Talk:Battle of Iron Works Hill/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=353725332 |action2=GTC |action2date=22:25, 28 April 2010 |action2link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/New York and New Jersey campaign/archive1 |action2result=not promoted |action2oldid=353725332 |action3=GTC |action3date=04:50, 17 December 2010 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured topic candidates/New York and New Jersey campaign/archive2 |action3result=promoted |ftname=New York and New Jersey campaign |topic=War |currentstatus=GA }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=GA||B-Class-1=yes|B-Class-2=yes|B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes|B-Class-5=yes|British=yes|US=yes|ARW=yes}} {{WPNJ|class=GA|importance=mid}} }} == [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Tag & Assess 2008]] == * Ensured that the article is: within project scope, tagged for task forces, and assessed for class. --[[User:Rosiestep|Rosiestep]] ([[User talk:Rosiestep|talk]]) 22:38, 26 April 2008 (UTC) == Use of "sic" == According to the article on sic, it is to be used when a spelling or grammatical error is in a citation and thus not an error of transcription. The citation quoted here uses a historically correct spelling of the word "maneuver." Since no error (it is historically correct) is in the citation, the inclusion of the "sic" is the error. Current usage and spelling is not superior, just different. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/159.121.204.129|159.121.204.129]] ([[User talk:159.121.204.129|talk]]) 20:06, 28 March 2012 (UTC)
